flawed_nl_solution:
At a 10 percent discount, Jordyn will pay 10/100%*$5=$0.5 less for a bag of cherries.
To buy one of the cherries at a 10% discount Jordyn will pay $5-$0.5=<<5-0.5=4.5>>4.5
The cost of buying 50 bags of cherries at the 10% discount is 50*4.5=<<50*4.5=225>>225
Also, at a 10% discount, Jordyn will pay 10/100*$7=<<10/100*7=0.7>>0.7 less for a bag of olives.
The price of a bag of olives at a 10% discount is $7-$0.7=<<7-0.7=63>>63
To buy 50 bags of olives Jordyn will pay $63*50=<<63*50=3150>>3150
The total cost of buying 50 bags of each fruit at a 10% discount is $3150+$225=$3375
#### 3375

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 6.3, not 63. It appears the decimal point was misplaced.
